intro: Dissochaeta furfurascens, commonly known as the hairy dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a rugged appearance. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Dissochaeta furfurascens produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ecological role in pollination.
